459.text:

463.text:
ability of the crane.  It has got a 30 metre

465.text:
and the effective radius is 36
centimetres.

469.text: So let's have a Cranes Etc Tutorial and the first thing we need to do is to

472.text:
convert our 36 centimeters into the
equivalent

477.text:
36 centimeters is 0.36 of a metre and
to convert it to a real-life radius we

483.text:
and the answer that we get is - quick as a
flash - 18 metres.

488.text:
So that's our real radius, let's go to
the lifting charts

492.text:
and for this configuration the real-life
capacity is 152 tonnes.

496.text:
To scale down the tonnage we need to do
a different calculation.

499.text:
Weight is related to volume so if we
have a cube the the volume of it is

503.text:
L x L x L , and I
hear you asking what the hell do you do

508.text:
Well to approximate the scale weight you take
the real weight and multiply it by 1/50

516.text:
In this case we know the real weight  is 152
tonnes

520.text:
and it turns out that's 152,000
kilogrammes.

525.text:
So to scale it down we multiply it out
by the 1/50s

533.text:
So that's the theory let's go back to our
test area

537.text:
and here using the counterweight blocks that
come with the model we've set up

540.text:
our load of 1.22 kilogrammes.  So now let's

546.text: and we'll see if it can lift it.

548.text:
So far it's got most of the load on and
the crane is not tipping.

552.text:
So let's add the last of our scaled weight
and see what happens...

557.text:
and its success because the crane can
lift its capacity of

563.text:
OK then tough guy, let's pull a bit

567.text:
and it seems to be managing with just a
few more weights.

573.text: and YES it is still able to hold it.

580.text:
But it does look like it's on the point
of tipping so let's just put one more on

585.text:
and yes with that on it's too much and
the crane starts to tip.

590.text:
So now let's weigh the load just before
the last of the weights was added

594.text:
and if we roughly allow for the weight of
the hook, its 1.5 kilogrammes

598.text:
which scales to 185 tonnes so the overload
factor on tipping is 20 percent

603.text:
which is less than you'd want on a real
crane.

618.text:
This model in the colours of 'Neeb Schuch'

622.text:
and it looks really good in this

626.text:
The model itself is really well detailed
and very well made and presented.

630.text:
All the features work well and it can be
configured in many different ways.

634.text:
If you want to really good crawler crane
model, this one is outstanding.
